Package com.anylogic.libraries.pypeline

Class FutureAttempt

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.anylogic.libraries.pypeline.FutureAttempt
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Future<Attempt>
    public class FutureAttempt
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.concurrent.Future<Attempt>
    An implementation of `Future` for being able to query the process/status of headless or non-blocking requests to Python.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      FutureAttempt​(Attempt result)
      Create an already-completed FutureAttempt.
      FutureAttempt​(java.lang.Process process)
      Create a FutureAttempt whose completion is based on a process running in the background.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      boolean cancel​(boolean mayInterruptIfRunning)  
      Attempt get()
      Retrieves the up-to-date status of the process (which may still be running).
      Attempt get​(long timeout, com.anylogic.engine.TimeUnits unit)
      Waits up until the specified timeout for the process to be finished before returning the final results.
      Attempt get​(long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Waits up until the specified timeout for the process to be finished before returning the final results.

      boolean isDone()

    • Constructor Detail

      • FutureAttempt

        public FutureAttempt​(java.lang.Process process)
        Create a FutureAttempt whose completion is based on a process running in the background.
        Parameters:
        process - Some in-progress or completed background process.

      • FutureAttempt

        public FutureAttempt​(Attempt result)
        Create an already-completed FutureAttempt. This is only intended for internal Pypeline use.
        Parameters:
        result - The completed Attempt

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public Attempt get()
        Retrieves the up-to-date status of the process (which may still be running).
        Specified by:
        get in interface java.util.concurrent.Future<Attempt>
        Returns:
        Attempt The current result of the process, containing the syserr and sysout up to the time of the call.

      • get

        public Attempt get​(long timeout,
                   java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
            throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                   java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Waits up until the specified timeout for the process to be finished before returning the final results.
        Specified by:
        get in interface java.util.concurrent.Future<Attempt>
        Parameters:
        timeout - The quantity of real-time to wait
        unit - The unit the timeout is in
        Returns:
        Attempt The result of the process, containing the syserr and sysout.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - If the timeout elapses without the process finishing

      • get

        public Attempt get​(long timeout,
                   com.anylogic.engine.TimeUnits unit)
            throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                   java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Waits up until the specified timeout for the process to be finished before returning the final results.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The quantity of real-time to wait
        unit - The unit the timeout is in (using the AnyLogic type for convenience)
        Returns:
        Attempt The result of the process, containing the syserr and sysout.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - If the timeout elapses without the process finishing

        Specified by:
        isDone in interface java.util.concurrent.Future<Attempt>
        Returns:
        Whether the underlying process is completed

      • cancel

        public boolean cancel​(boolean mayInterruptIfRunning)
        Specified by:
        cancel in interface java.util.concurrent.Future<Attempt>
        Parameters:
        mayInterruptIfRunning - Whether the process can be force-quit if it's still in progress
        Returns:
        Whether the process was interrupted

      • isCancelled

        public boolean isCancelled()
        Specified by:
        isCancelled in interface java.util.concurrent.Future<Attempt>
        Returns:
        Whether the processes was force-quit (e.g., from the user calling `cancel(true)` or the thread being interrupted from `get(timeout,...)`
